name: Roast Chicken
ingredients:
4 pound whole chicken

1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted

4 tablespoons olive oil

1/4 cup white wine, optional Sauvignon or Chardonnay

1 lemon, halved

Salt and pepper

2 tablespoons chopped parsley

4 garlic cloves, minced

1 head of garlic roughly peeled

3 fresh whole rosemary sprigs

1 Roasting pan
description:
Take chicken out of fridge one to two hours before starting your roast. Don’t forget to remove giblets and neck from cavity.

Preheat oven at 430°F.

Rinse and pat dry the chicken with paper towel.

Season the chicken generously, outside and inside with salt, pepper and parsley. 

Combine olive oil, melted butter, wine and lemon juice.

Rub the above mixture all over the chicken, under the skin and inside the cavity.

Stuff the garlic head into the chicken cavity along with the thyme, the rosemary sprigs and the squeezed lemon halve.

 Set the chicken breast-side up in a roasting pan, and place in the oven.

After one hour, lower the temperature to 325°F for another 20 to 30 minutes.

If the skin looks burnt, lay an aluminum foil on top of the chicken and continue cooking.

Baste the chicken every 30 minutes.

When the Chicken is cooked, remove it from the oven, cover with foil and allow to stand for 10 minutes before carving.

Drizzle with juices from pan and lemon juice, then serve.

name: Meatballs
ingredients:
1/2 pound ground beef

1/2 pound ground lamb

1/3 cup bread crumbs

1/3 cup milk

1 egg yolk

1 tbsp tomato paste

1/3 cup of grated Parmesan

1/3 cup flour (for the very end)

1 onion 

2 garlic cloves

1/3 bunch of cilantro (optional)

1/2 tsp Salt, pepper, cayenne

2 cups of tomato sauce

1 cup of vegetable oil 

1 mixing bowl
description:
If using breadcrumbs, disregard this first step. Put the bread to soak in the milk during 5 minutes then press it between your fingers. You can discard the rest of the milk.

In your mixing bowl, place all the ingredients except the flour.

Mix everything carefully, using your hands if possible.

Roll the meatballs between your two hands, then roll each meat ball in the flour and set the floured meat balls on a plate.

Put the plate with the meat balls in the fridge for about one hour (very important step).

Warm the oil at 350°F in a frying pan and cook the meat balls in small batches so the oil’s temperature stays the same throughout. You want the meatballs to get golden brown but not fully cooked.

Take out them once golden brown, set them aside and discard the oil (but do not wash the pan).

Add the tomato sauce in the pan, warm at 300°F approximately. When the sauce is warm, add the meatballs cover the pan with a lid and let cook for another 15 to 20 minutes.

Serve your meatballs on rice, spaghetti, or mashed potatoes, with a side of green lettuce.

name: Spiced Chickpea Salad
ingredients:
Chickpeas

400g / 14 oz can chickpeas, drained

2 tbsp olive oil

Chickpeas spices

1 tsp ground cumin

1 1/2 tsp All Spice

1 tsp ground cardamon

1/4 tsp salt

Salad

2 cucumbers , diced

2 tomatoes, diced

1 red onion (small) , diced

1/4 cup coriander leaves (cilantro), roughly chopped

1/4 cup Italian parsley, roughly chopped

Dressing 

1 1/2 tbsp sherry or balsamic vinegar

Zest of half a lemon

2 tbsp lemon juice

1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil

1 tsp caster sugar

1 or 2 garlic clove, smashed

Salt and pepper
description:
Combine the Dressing ingredients in a jar and shake. Set aside for 20 minutes to allow the flavors to develop.

Place chickpeas in a large bowl. Scatter over Spices, toss to coat. The wetness of the chickpeas will make the spices stick.

Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a large pan over high heat and fry the chickpeas for a couple of minutes. Shake the pan so the chickpeas roll, or stir gently (so the spice coating doesn't come off). Transfer into bowl and cool slightly.

Combine the Salad Ingredients in a bowl. Drizzle with a bit of Dressing and toss. Transfer to serving bowl.

Top salad with chickpeas (warm or at room temperature). Drizzle with more Dressing. Toss very gently, if desired (don't toss too much or spices may shake off of the chickpeas). Serve immediately.

Great served with Greek yogurt and pita bread to stuff the salad into.

name: Oeufs Mimosa (Deviled Eggs)
ingredients:
12 Eggs

1/2 cup Mayonnaise

1/2 cup Fresh Parsley chopped fine

1/2 cup of black pitted Mediterranean olives

6 anchovies (optional)

Herbed salt
description:
Prep 6 cups of water to boil in a large pot.

When the water reaches a rolling boil, drop in the eggs delicately.

After 10 minutes, strain the water from the pan and run cold water over the eggs to cool them quickly.

Peel them: it is easier to peel the eggs under running water.

Cut the hard boiled eggs in half lengthwise. Carefully remove the yolks with a spoon and divide the yolks into two batches in separate bowls.

Batch 1: Mash the egg yolks, add some herbed salt, then add just enough mayonnaise to make a smooth spread  and fill the egg whites with this spread.

Batch 2: Using a Rotary Cheese Grater or a grater with small holes, grate the yolks in a bowl.

Add parsley and sea salt to that batch and mix delicately with a fork.

Sprinkle the fluffy egg yolk generously over the filled eggs.

Decorate with half pitted olive and half anchovy.

name: Apple Compote
ingredients:
3 peeled apples

1/4 cup brown sugar

2 sticks of cinnamon

1/2 cup of water

1 sauce pot

1 matching lid
description:
Peel and cut the apples in quarters

Place the apples in a medium sized sauce pot with water and sprinkle with brown sugar. Place the cinnamon sticks in pot with apples

After 10 minutes, lower the heat to a low heat or fire to simmer for an hour.

When the apples are soft to the touch, they are ready. Take them off the heat and let them rest. Serve hot or cold.

Enjoy!

name: Caramel Flan
ingredients:
When you find out

And write it in here

Thanks
description:
Make the caramel
